comment.author: 18697358@N00
comment._content:
interesting photo,
a big no thank you - to the frills & corsets 
and an even bigger no thank you to the status of those women. 
At that time - still little better than 'property'.
1909 Women garment workers strike in New York for better wages and working conditions in the Uprising of the 20,000. Over 300 shops eventually sign union contracts. 
1960 Women now earn only 60 cents for every dollar earned by men, a decline since 1955. Women of color earn only 42 cents.

comment.author: 9691753@N02
comment._content:
I sort of wonder what they were thinking.  I wonder about their personal lives, their interests, friends, families.  I wonder if they were political.  I wonder about the different foods they ate.
Were the dresses 'off the rack?'  Was there such a thing then? :)
I would like to have been with each as she picked out the hat she is wearing.  I imagine that that would have been pleasant.

It is painful to read some of the comments from folks who find admitting to the inequalities of the time as 'creating' victims.
If I lived at that time my life would have been so different.  If that were me standing there instead of being here in 2010 how much smaller my world would have been than it has been, even if I had had money.  My daughters would not have the same rights or opportunities as my sons.  I would have had to teach my daughters how to be very good at taking up less space in the world.  It would be very important that I taught them that lesson well.

comment.author: 7339565@N08
comment._content:
Beyond tired of hearing how 'women ' were victims then ( and Now ! ) FYI- if you look at MOST photos ( not ALL ) from the inception of the photography up until the about WW1- they didnt smile because the process of capturing the image was very slow. Sometimes you will see a photo where someone moved and the image is blurred. Try sitting for several minutes and smile- after afew moments your smile fades.
 I'm sick and tired of uninformed 'modern' types implanting their impressions upon a time in which they know little about the technologies,social mores and social orders of the day...
 These women probably did just fine in life given the perameters in which they had to work in...just like folks today will shine in life or not- given all of the limitations that one has to deal with.
